dct_title_s: A map of the world corrected by ye latest observations
dct_description_sm: California shown as a labeled island with a slightly indented northern coast. Includes one large lake next to the northrn coast on the continent.
Includes a portion of New Zealand's eastern coastline.

Likely after Herman Moll's "A map of the world on wch. is delineated the voyages of Robinson Curso." London, 1719 and probably printed for an edition of Daniel Defoe's "Robinson Cursoe". Includes a dotted line showing the fictitious voyage over land and sea. "R. Crusos I" appears off the northern coast of South America.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
